data.text: And it came to pass in the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah king of Judah, that Rezin the king of Syria, and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up towards Jerusalem to war against it, but could not prevail against it.
And it was told the house of David, saying, Syria is confederate with Ephraim. And his heart was moved, and the heart of his people, as the trees of the wood are moved with the wind.
Then said the Lord unto Isaiah, Go forth now to meet Ahaz, thou, and Shear-jashub thy son, at the end of the conduit of the upper pool in the highway of the fullerâ€™s field;
and say unto him,
Because Syria, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah,
Let us go up against Judah, and vex it,
Thus saith the Lord God,
For the head of Syria is Damascus,
And the head of Ephraim is Samaria,
Moreover the Lord spake again unto Ahaz, saying,
Ask thee a sign of the Lord thy God;
But Ahaz said, I will not ask, neither will I tempt the Lord.
And he said,
Therefore the Lord himself shall give you a sign;
Butter and honey shall he eat,
For before the child shall know to refuse the evil, and choose the good,
The Lord shall bring upon thee,
And it shall come to pass in that day,
And they shall come, and shall rest all of them
In the same day shall the Lord shave with a rasor that is hired,
And it shall come to pass in that day,
And it shall come to pass, for the abundance of milk that they shall give he shall eat butter:
And it shall come to pass in that day,
With arrows and with bows shall men come thither;
And on all hills that shall be digged with the mattock,
